title: Internet Freedom and Family Empowerment Act
content: Internet Freedom and Family Empowerment Act - Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to establish Government policy promoting continued development of the Internet and other interactive computer services and media and preserving the competitive free market existing for them. Addresses concerns over objectionable materials on such services, sexual and otherwise. Shields the service provider and user from: (1) treatment as publisher or speaker of any information provided by an information content provider. And (2) liability for good faith actions taken to restrict access to such materials. Declares that nothing in this Act shall be construed to authorize Federal Communications Commission regulation of the content of such services.
